alert.note: Alert for Rota (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 5:53PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Due to the proximity of a tropical disturbance, JTWC Invest 93W located northwest of the Marianas, more substantial rainfall is anticipated through Wednesday across the Marianas. The greatest coverage is currently expected across the CNMI. Satellite analysis, model guidance and previous trends indicate possibility for rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches through Wednesday. Localized training cells can bring up to 4 to 6 inches of rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
